messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Wholly Unschoolers!
messages.msgSnippet: ... There ya go, just when I m sure there is nothing for me to comment on, someone has to go and mention Neil. ~squee~ -- Julie W
messages.messageBody:
Pam Sorooshian wrote:

>
> I don't know - "Cannibalistic Unschoolers" has been popping up in my
> head all day.
>
> (Must be because I'm reading "American Gods" by Neil Gaiman and have
> all kinds of weird stuff in my head.)
>
> -pam
>
There ya go, just when I'm sure there is nothing for me to comment on,
someone has to go and mention Neil.
~squee~

--

Julie W

http://jwoolfolk.typepad.com/theothermother/

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Wholly Unschoolers!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh no - did I use my outside voice?  -pam
messages.messageBody:
On Apr 29, 2005, at 6:29 PM, Jordan wrote:

> Pam—
> Maybe you should think about keeping that weird stuff IN your head?

Oh no - did I use my outside voice? <BEG>

-pam

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Wholly Unschoolers!
messages.msgSnippet: Pam— Maybe you should think about keeping that weird stuff IN your head? Wait though—if we do a NM camp, and we adopt the “cannibalistic unschoolers” ,
messages.messageBody:
Pam�
Maybe you should think about keeping that weird stuff IN your head?

Wait though�if we do a NM camp, and we adopt the �cannibalistic unschoolers�
, we can have our own �Lord of the Flies� living diorama!

WE could charge admission, and become �capitalistic unschoolers�!!

Oh, the possibilities!

Tami�who REALLY needs a Lotaburger!

-----Original Message-----
From: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of Pam Sorooshian
Sent: Saturday, April 30, 2005 10:18 AM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Wholly Unschoolers!


On Apr 29, 2005, at 6:04 PM, Jordan wrote:

> I'm fond of "pernicious unschoolers" but I'm sure it sends the wrong
> message-just a little harsh, don'tcha think?


I don't know - "Cannibalistic Unschoolers" has been popping up in my
head all day.

(Must be because I'm reading "American Gods" by Neil Gaiman and have
all kinds of weird stuff in my head.)

-pam

messages.subject: Wholly Unschoolers!
messages.msgSnippet: I m fond of pernicious unschoolers  but I m sure it sends the wrong message-just a little harsh, don tcha think? How about synergistic unschoolers ?  nah,
messages.messageBody:
I'm fond of "pernicious unschoolers" but I'm sure it sends the wrong
message-just a little harsh, don'tcha think?

How about "synergistic unschoolers"? nah, sounds kinda like hygienic, which
reminds me of the dentist. Yuck.

Oh, here we go: Holy Bathing Caps, Batman, it's the "synchronized
unschoolers" !!! Or, lets all synchronize our watches and NOT "do math" at
the same time! :)

Tami, whose real dream house is the bat-cave!

--
